title: Cleveland police officer identified after son fatally shoots himself with officer's gun
content:
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- Cleveland police released the name of the officer whose 2-year-old son found his police-issued service weapon, shot himself and later died.
The service weapon belonged to 54-year-old Jose Pedro, who was hired in 1993, Cleveland police spokesman Reginald Lanton said.
He said the investigation is still in the early stages and no arrests have been made.
The shooting happened about 10:30 a.m. Friday at a home in the 38000 block of Library Avenue in the city's Brooklyn Centre neighborhood.
A neighbor, Sonya Hobbs, called 911 after the shooting. She told cleveland.com that the child suffered a gunshot wound to the head.
Cleveland.com has requested a copy of Pedro's personnel file.
Lanton said more information will be given as it becomes available.
